Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Serrano, S.5859-B, and Assembly Member Joyner, A.8120-B, “AN ACT to authorize the commissioner of parks and recreation of the city of New York to enter into an agreement for the operation of a children's program known as the Bronx Children's Museum in a portion of a building located in Mill Pond Park in the borough of the Bronx”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Bronx Children's Museum (S.5859-B/A.8120-B)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6035, and Assembly Members Markey, DenDekker, A.6083, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to providing a special accidental death benefit to employees of the department of sanitation of the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Accidental Death Benefit ( S.6035/A.6083)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.8015, and Committee on Rules (at request of Assembly Member Abbate), A.10567, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability benefits for certain members of the New York city fire department pension fund; and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the powers, duties and responsibilities of the board of trustees of the New York city fire department pension fund, and in relation to authorizing such board of trustees to draw upon the assets of such fund to pay expenses”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: FDNY Disability Benefits (S.8015/A.10567)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation that would raise the number of U-visas available annually and establish a uniform protocol for law enforcement review of victim certification requests
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Raise the number of U-visas available annually and establish a uniform protocol for law enforcement review of victim certification requests.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to demographic data of library card holders
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Demographic data of library card holders.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to traffic signal preemption systems
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Traffic signal preemption systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring automated external defibrillators in private schools and police cars
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring automated external defibrillators in private schools and police cars.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) to create a donation system, which allows purchasers of MetroCards to make a voluntary monetary contribution to a fund for low-income New Yorkers and a means to collect unused MetroCards to donate to low-income commuters
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to create a donation system, which allows purchasers of MetroCards to make a voluntary monetary contribution to a fund for low-income New Yorkers and a means to collect unused MetroCards to donate to low-income commuters.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.3137, legislation providing retroactivity to the original date of eligibility for the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) program
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Providing retroactivity to the original date of eligibility for the senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) program. (A. 3137)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign the Pharmaceutical Cost Transparency Act (S.5338A), which would require prescription drug manufacturers to file an annual report disclosing certain financial information pertaining to high-cost prescription drugs
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Pharmaceutical Cost Transparency Act (S.5338A)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on job creation and employment programs of public housing agencies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Reporting on job creation and employment programs of public housing agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to high school graduation rates of youth in foster care
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: High school graduation rates of youth in foster care.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on ticket vendors to address the use of ticket bots by finding a technological solution that would prevent the use of illegal software, limiting the number of tickets that can be purchased per-person and charging reasonable fees
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Ticket vendors to address the use of ticket bots by finding a technological solution that would prevent the use of illegal software, limiting the number of tickets that can be purchased per-person and charging reasonable fees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the State to require all New York State Correctional facilities to inform previously-incarcerated people of their right to vote at the time they exit the prison system
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Require all NYS Correctional facilities to inform previously-incarcerated people of their right to vote at the time they exit the prison system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to designate Ecuador for Temporary Protected Status to provide temporary immigration relief to eligible Ecuadorian nationals in the wake of a devastating earthquake.

Items.MatterName: Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to designate Ecuador for Temporary Protected Status to provide temporary immigration relief to eligible Ecuadorian nationals in the wake of a devastating earthquake.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. C 160124 ZSK shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to application no. N 160126 ZRK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 19-33 Kent Avenue, Brooklyn (C160124ZSK and N160126ZRK)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:
Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Puiblic Advocate (Ms. James) recessed the Meeting subject to call.
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:



Int No. 775-A: 40-10-0  (Negative: CMs Barron, Chin, Dromm, Garodnick, Johnson, Kallos, Levin, Levine, Mendez, and Rosenthal)

See files for individual votes.

Note:  SLRs No. 4 to 7 were adopted by the Council by a two-thirds affirmative vote; Bluebacks concerning the passage of SLRs 4 to 7, signed and certified by the City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney), were sent to Albany for filing with the State Senate and State Assembly.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
